newsitem.title: SPAIN: Tabacalera to lose distribution mkt share - press.
newsitem.headline: Tabacalera to lose distribution mkt share - press.

text.p: Spain's Competition Commission has approved a measure to oblige Tabacalera to distribute its cigarettes via U.S firm McLane, the financial daily Expansion reported on Thursday.
The Spanish firm is the sole national manufacturer of tobacco, and has a near-monopoly in distribution with 90 percent control of the Spanish market.
According to Expansion, McLane will be able to compete with Tabacalera in terms of pricing of the Spanish firm's brands.
The report said Tabacalera will have the option of appealing the decision.
A spokesman for Tabacalera said: "Until we have the text of the decision we cannot evaluate its possible impact on our business."
In 1996, Tabacalera reported consolidated sales for the tobacco business of 699.64 billion pesetas, up 6.4 percent.
McLane's operations in Spain are split between retailing in fast food chains and service station shops.
The Spanish subsidiary is 30 percent held by energy group Repsol and 35 percent owned by both McLane International and Chupa Chups.
